title: What is difference between relegation and auto relegation
body: Can someone pls explain this concept, when ur auto relegated that means ur forever out of lcs? and to be relegated means that you have to return to challenger series to fight to be in lcs?

replies.body:
Autorelegation: Out of the LCS the next split, automatically in challenger series
Relegation: Play a challenger team for your LCS spot next split

Auto relegation means you do not get to fight for your spot in the LCS during the Promotion Tournament, and are automatically relegated to the Challenger Series. You can though compete in the Challenger series and if you place high enough participate in the next promotion tournament to get into the LCS again. This only happens to the 10th place LCS team.

Relegation is for the 8/9th place teams of the LCS, and they then face the 2nd/3rd place teams from the Challenger series to see who gets to compete in the next LCS split. They are only actually relegated if they lose.

Just to add to this beautiful post, with the 10th place LCS team being auto-relegated, the 1st place Challenger team is Auto-Promoted to LCS (taking the auto-relegated spot).

NA:
Winterfox get to pick who they want to fight in relegation tournament.
Dignitas get leftovers.
Coast are Auto-Relegated. 

EU: 
ROCCAT pick.
Giants get leftovers.
MeetYourMakers are Auto-Relegated.

We do not know the Auto-Promoted as the Challenger Series Playoffs have not happened yet.

**Light Green** (C9 and TSM): Advance directly to semi-finals of the playoffs. Automatically qualified for summer split.
**Blue**(CLG, TiP, GV and TL): Advance to first round of playoffs. Automatically qualified for summer split.
**Grey**(T8): Out of playoffs. Automatically qualified for summer split.
**Orange**(Winterfox and Dignitas): Out of playoffs. Plays promotion tournament to get back to summer split.
**Pink**(Team Coast): Out of playoffs. Out of Summer Split

Consequently, Team that places 1st in the NA CS promotion tournament will occupy Team Coast's spot in summer split.
Teams placed 2nd and 3rd will occupy the other 2 spots.
